Conduct a thorough self-examination regularly to look for signs of injury, such as cuts, bruises, and scratches, and to ensure that you do not have any hidden injuries that could worsen over time.
Seek out medical attention if you suspect that you have sustained or are at risk of sustaining an injury, even if you do not feel physical sensations.
Consult with healthcare professionals for guidance on how to protect yourself based on your specific activities and any pre-existing medical conditions.
Practice proper posture and ergonomics to minimize strain and reduce the risk of injury.
Avoid putting weight on injured areas until they are healed sufficiently to bear weight safely.
